DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to identify whether sleep-disordered breathing - as measured by overnight polysomnography - is associated with pre-eclampsia and to determine whether use of positive airway pressure can improve nocturnal blood pressure.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Positive Airway Pressure in Preeclampsia to Reduce Blood Pressure
DOC.criteria: Women with preeclampsia who receive care at the University of Michigan Hospitals Aged at least 14 years old. No current use of PAP therapy. Willing and able to provide informed consent. Current PAP therapy Any medical reason why PAP therapy may not be suitable (e.g., in patients with recent head trauma). Cognitively impaired and unable to understand informed consent.
